pr_title: More strict decoding of HTTP/1.x start-line

timeline.message: handlePartialInitialLine: ensure there is at least one byte

timeline.bodyText: any reason not to use a ByteProcessor here to reduce calls to getByte?
timeline.author: Scottmitch

timeline.bodyText: consider doing validation only for custom header names, most of the time we shouldn't have to do the validation because it is handled in the lookup (e.g. if it matches a cached entry it is upper case). It is worth paying the string conversion costs assuming most of the time we will get a valid string.
timeline.author: Scottmitch
Scottmitch

https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7230#section-3.1.2

A client SHOULD ignore the reason-phrase content.

sad to waste cycles validating something that should be ignored 😢
timeline.author: Scottmitch

replies.bodyText:
We can optimize the "most-likely path" of hitting the known status code if we will make HttpResponseStatus.valueOf(int) public. Right know, there is no cheap way to check if we already have a constant for the status-code because we always fallback to new HttpResponseStatus that is relatively expensive. We can do that in a follow up. Something like:

Check if the status-code is known.
If yes, return the constant. If no, do the validation and create a new HttpResponseStatus.
